response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<MyClass> it = myParser.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  try {
    MyClass myClass = it.next();
    // .. do stuff ..
  } catch (Exception e) {
    // .. do exception stuff ..
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the try-catch block to handle the exception.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject: I have a JSONObject that contains a key called "name". I want to get the value of this key. I tried using JSONObject.get("name") but it doesn't work.
Please using this api: JSONObject.get("name").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.get("name")
<<<code>>>: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String name = jsonObject.getString("name");
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the getString() method to get the value of a key in a JSONObject.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONArray: I have a JSONArray that contains a key called "name". I want to get the value of this key. I tried using JSONArray.get("name") but it doesn't work.
Please using this api: JSONArray.get("name").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONArray.get("name")
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(jsonString);
String name = jsonArray.getString(0);
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the getString() method to get the value of a key in a JSONArray.
